paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: Various, including patients from Sweden, Portugal, Brazil, Japan, and the United States.
patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis with gastrointestinal symptoms.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Gastrointestinal symptoms including unintentional weight loss.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Virtually all Swedish V30M patients develop GI complications during the course of the disease.

functional_data.summary: The V30M mutation is associated with a higher prevalence of gastrointestinal symptoms.

variants.segregation_data: The V30M mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.population_frequency: Common in endemic areas, particularly in Sweden and Portugal.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical observations.
variants.additional_notes: The V30M mutation is the most common form in endemic areas.
key_quotes: The V30M mutation is the most common form in endemic areas.
GI symptoms were generally more prevalent in V30M than in non-V30M patients (69.3% vs. 56.0%, p < 0.001).

tables_processed.table_caption: Most abundant TTR mutations and their clinical manifestations

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text and tables.
